Home → New in and suggestions → Staff Picks → Reviews

Reviews

Read staff and customer reviews of books and reserve to collect from your library, or download to your device.

The Little Paris Bookshop by Nina George

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Jan 19, 2017

The Borrowers book group find The Little Paris Bookshop intense and thought-provoking.

The Garden of Evening Mists by Tan Twan Eng

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Jan 17, 2017

The Borrowers book group find The Garden of Evening Mists a beautifully written book to be savoured rather than rushed.

The Seamstress by Maria Duenas

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Jan 12, 2017

Off for some winter sun? The Borrowers recommend this long and absorbing novel for the beach.

Ross Poldark by Winston Graham

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Jan 10, 2017

The Borrowers book group found Ross Poldark well written and steeped in historical context.

The Cleaner of Chartres by Salley Vickers

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Jan 5, 2017

The Borrowers book group found The Cleaner of Chartres 'a delightful read'

Burial Rites by Hannah Kent

Written by The Borrowers Book Group · Published Jan 3, 2017

The Borrowers book group found Burial Rites 'beautifully descriptive', and 'poignant'

Circle by Jeannie Baker

Written by Jacky Offord · Published Dec 29, 2016

Circle provides a 'stunning', 'meticulously collaged' and 'seamless' account of the godwit's annual migration.

The Ladybird Book of the Meeting, by Jason Hazeley & Joel Morris

Written by Alison Wheeler · Published Dec 24, 2016

Chief executive officer Alison Wheeler recommends The Ladybird Book of the Meeting, by Jason Hazeley & Joel Morris.

The Girl With No Name, by Diney Costeloe

Written by Alice Violett · Published Dec 23, 2016

Web content editor Alice Violett recommends The Girl With No Name, by Diney Costeloe.

Tales of Horror and the Supernatural, by Arthur Machen

Written by Leon Paternoster · Published Dec 22, 2016

Deputy head of IT Leon Paternoster recommends Tales of Horror and the Supernatural, by Arthur Machen.

The Outrun, by Amy Liptrot

Written by Paul Howarth · Published Dec 21, 2016

Stock and content manager Paul Howarth recommends The Outrun, by Amy Liptrot.

The Shepherd's Life: a tale of the Lake District by James Rebanks

Written by Helen Scrivener · Published Dec 20, 2016

Helen is impressed by Rebanks' realistic viewpoint and various talents.

A Place Called Winter, by Patrick Gale

Written by Theo Clarke · Published Dec 20, 2016

Library and information advisor Theo Clarke recommends A Place Called Winter, by Patrick Gale.

The Last of the Spirits, by Chris Priestley

Written by Chris Howard · Published Dec 19, 2016

Lakenheath Library manager Chris Howard recommends The Last of the Spirits, by Chris Priestley.

Elizabeth Is Missing, by Emma Healey

Written by Audrey Woodley · Published Dec 18, 2016

Haverhill Library library and information advisor Audrey Woodley recommends Elizabeth Is Missing, by Emma Healey.

Fresh India: 130 quick, easy and delicious vegetarian recipes for every day, by Meera Sodha

Written by Gayla Rowling · Published Dec 17, 2016

Leiston Library manager Gayla Rowling recommends Fresh India: 130 quick, easy and delicious vegetarian recipes for every day, by Meera Sodha.

Mark the centenary of late Suffolk-based author Penelope Fitzgerald's birth by discovering her books

Written by Brandon King · Published Dec 17, 2016

17 December marks the centenary of author Penelope Fitzgerald's birth. Why not try her novel The Bookshop, inspired by her experiences of living and working in Southwold, or one of her other titles?

Mindfulness in Eight Weeks, by Michael Chaskalson

Written by Helen Kerridge · Published Dec 16, 2016

Library and information advisor Helen Kerridge recommends Mindfulness in Eight Weeks, by Michael Chaskalson.

A Body in Barcelona, by Jason Webster

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Dec 15, 2016

Stock team member Jo Dixon recommends A Body in Barcelona, by Jason Webster.

Ticket To Ride: Europe

Written by Andrew Miller · Published Dec 14, 2016

Library and information advisor Andrew Miller recommends the board game Ticket To Ride: Europe, which is available to hire from the branch's Board Games Library.

I'll Be Home For Christmas, by various authors

Written by Debra Rowe · Published Dec 13, 2016

Library and information advisor Debra Rowe recommends I'll Be Home For Christmas, by various authors.

A Gift From Bob by James Bowen

Written by Gill Mason · Published Dec 13, 2016

Have tissues at the ready for this instalment of the 'sensitive and moving' rags-to-riches tale of James and his superstar cat.

Bilbo The Lifeguard Dog: a true story of friendship and heroism, by Steven Jamieson

Written by Natasha Catchpole · Published Dec 12, 2016

Bury St Edmunds Library staff member Natasha Catchpole recommends Bilbo The Lifeguard Dog: a true story of friendship and heroism, by Steven Jamieson.

The Polar Express

Written by Alison Catchpole · Published Dec 11, 2016

Gainsborough Library staff member Alison Catchpole recommends The Polar Express.

The Tailor of Gloucester, by Beatrix Potter

Written by Charlotte Clark · Published Dec 10, 2016

Southwold Library manager Charlotte Clark recommends The Tailor of Gloucester, by Beatrix Potter.

A Visit From St Nicholas, by Clement C. Moore.

Written by Gill Turner · Published Dec 9, 2016

Bury St Edmunds Library assistant manager Gill Turner recommends A Visit From St Nicholas, by Clement C. Moore.

The Bubble Boy, by Stewart Foster

Written by Krystal Vittles · Published Dec 8, 2016

Libraries innovation and development manager Krystal Vittles recommends The Bubble Boy, by Stewart Foster.

The Book Thief, by Markus Zusak.

Written by Tanya Collins · Published Dec 7, 2016

library and information advisor Tanya Collins recommends The Book Thief, by Markus Zusak.

The BFG

Written by Kate Bacon · Published Dec 6, 2016

Bookstart administrator Kate Bacon recommends the film The BFG.

Room

Written by Nilima Banerji · Published Dec 5, 2016

Library and information advisor Nilima Banerji recommends the film Room

Elf

Written by Emma Yarrow · Published Dec 4, 2016

Elmswell Library manager Emma Yarrow recommends the film Elf.

Ten Little Elves, by Michael Brownlow & Simon Rickerty.

Written by Dawn Bamford · Published Dec 3, 2016

Kedington Library manager Dawn Bamford recommends Ten Little Elves, by Michael Brownlow & Simon Rickerty.

The Dinosaur That Pooped Christmas, by Tom Fletcher, Dougie Poynter & Garry Parsons

Written by Emma Maguire · Published Dec 2, 2016

Library and information advisor Emma Maguire recommends The Dinosaur That Pooped Christmas, by Tom Fletcher, Dougie Poynter & Garry Parsons.

The Zig Zag Girl by Elly Griffiths

Written by Bev Dann · Published Dec 1, 2016

Murder mystery The Zig Zag Girl offers interesting insights into life on the variety circuit in the 1950s

The Secret Diary of Hendrik Groen, 83 ¼, by Anonymous.

Written by Jo Dixon · Published Dec 1, 2016

Stock team member Jo Dixon recommends The Secret Diary of Hendrik Groen, 83 ¼, by an anonymous Dutch author.

The Sun King by Nancy Mitford

Written by Gill Mason · Published Nov 29, 2016

In The Sun King, Nancy Mitford describes Louis XIV's arts patronage, luxurious and extravagant lifestyle at Versailles, absolutist style of rule and colourful personal life.

Raptor: A Journey Through Birds by James MacDonald Lockhart

Written by Helen Haynes · Published Sep 12, 2016

Helen reviews a hymn to the magnificent buzzards and kestrels of the British Isles.

Harry Potter and the Cursed Child by JK Rowling and J Thorne

Written by Helen Haynes · Published Sep 9, 2016

Helen reviews the latest in the Harry Potter series, a play combining the past and present.

I am China by Xiaolu Guo

Written by Alexandra Carter · Published Aug 23, 2016

Alexandra Carter from the Woodbridge Library Readersâ€™ Circle reviews Xialou Guo's novel about a translator.

The Twilight Hour by Nicci Gerrard

Written by Gill Mason · Published Aug 9, 2016

Library and information advisor at Felixstowe, Gill Mason, reviews Nicci Gerrard's novel about a woman with a dark past.

Signs Preceding the End of the World by Yuri Herrera

Written by Richard Baker · Published Jul 26, 2016

Library and information advisor at Woodbridge, Richard Baker, reviews one of the Brave New Reads.

The Last Pilot by Benjamin Johncock

Written by Sophie Green · Published Jul 5, 2016

Woodbridge Library assistant manager Sophie Green reviews one of the Brave New Reads.

Mrs Hemingway by Naomi Wood

Written by Helen Scrivener · Published May 3, 2016

Woodbridge Library Manager Helen Scrivener reviews a book based on Ernest Hemingway's marriages.

Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are Dead by Tom Stoppard

Written by Harriet Avery · Published Apr 18, 2016

Library and information advisor, Harriet Avery from Felixstowe Library, reviews this Hamlet-inspired play published in 1966 in honour of Felixstowe Library's 50th anniversary.

The signature of all things by Elizabeth Gilbert

Written by Helen Scrivener · Published Mar 30, 2016

Woodbridge Library manager Helen Scrivener reviews this sweeping saga.

Station eleven by Emily St. John Mandel

Written by Helen Scrivener · Published Jan 12, 2016

Woodbridge Library manager Helen Scrivener reviews Station eleven by Emily St. John Mandel.

A monster calls by Patrick Ness

Written by Kate Ashton · Published Dec 30, 2015

Haverhill Library assistant manager Kate Ashton reviews young adult novel, A monster calls.

Disclaimer by Renee Knight

Written by Amanda King · Published Dec 8, 2015

Amanda King, manager of Bungay Library reviews this thriller.

The kind worth killing by Peter Swanson

Written by Amanda King · Published Nov 4, 2015

Bungay Library manager Amanda King reviews a compelling thriller.

The book of strange new things by Michel Faber

Written by Helen Scrivener · Published Oct 21, 2015

Woodbridge Library manager Helen Scrivener reviews The book of strange new things, a futuristic sci-fi novel.

Hear the wind sing and Pinball, 1973 by Haruki Murakami

Written by Matt Shenton · Published Sep 9, 2015

Literacy ambassador Matt Shenton reviews Hear the wind sing and Pinball, 1973 by Haruki Murakami - two newly translated stories from over 30 years ago.

Jurassic Park by Michael Crichton

Written by Kate Ashton · Published Jun 22, 2015

Haverhill Library assistant manager Kate Ashton reviews Jurassic Park.

Blue Monday by Nicci French

Written by Charlotte Clark · Published Jun 18, 2015

Southwold Library manager Charlotte Clark reviews the thriller, Blue Monday by crime-writing couple Nicci French.

Sesame and spice by Anne Shooter

Written by Debra Rowe · Published Jun 18, 2015

Debra Rowe, a library and information advisor at Felixstowe Library, reviews Anne Shooter's exploration of international recipes.

The narrow road to the deep north by Richard Flanagan

Written by Helen Scrivener · Published Jun 18, 2015

Woodbridge Library manager Helen Scrivener reviews the 2014 Man Booker Prize winner, The narrow road to the deep north.

The quickening maze by Adam Foulds

Written by Helen Scrivener · Published Jun 18, 2015

Woodbridge Library manager Helen Scrivener reviews The quickening maze, a novel about the poets John Clare and Alfred Tennyson.
